title: S&P Global Acquires Climate-Risk Data Firm 'Sustainalytics AI'
description: S&P Global announced the acquisition of Sustainalytics AI, a European firm specializing in AI-powered physical asset climate risk modeling. The acquisition will integrate advanced predictive analytics into S&P Global's Sustainable1 platform, enhancing its ability to provide clients with granular data on climate-related financial risks for real estate and infrastructure portfolios. This move directly addresses increasing regulatory pressure and investor demand for sophisticated ESG and climate intelligence.

title: S&P Global Announces $2 Billion Accelerated Share Repurchase Program
description: The company's Board of Directors has authorized a new $2 billion accelerated share repurchase (ASR) program, signaling confidence in its financial outlook and commitment to returning capital to shareholders. The ASR is part of the company's existing share buyback authorization and is expected to be completed by the second quarter of 2026. This action reflects strong cash flow generation following the successful integration of recent acquisitions.

title: S&P Global Announces Expanded Partnership with Palantir
description: S&P Global expanded its existing partnership with Palantir Technologies to co-develop a new AI-powered supply chain risk management platform. The platform will integrate S&P Global's extensive trade, commodity, and corporate data with Palantir's Foundry operating system. This collaboration is designed to help corporate and government clients model complex supply chain scenarios, identify vulnerabilities, and mitigate disruptions in real-time.

title: S&P Global Acquires PrivaData Corp.
description: S&P Global announced the acquisition of PrivaData Corp., a specialized data provider focused on the private credit and unlisted equity markets. This strategic move aims to significantly expand S&P Global Market Intelligence's coverage of private capital, a rapidly growing asset class where reliable data is scarce. The integration will enhance S&P's valuation services and provide clients with deeper insights into private company performance and credit risk.

title: S&P Global Divests its Engineering & Product Design Data Division to KKR
description: As part of its ongoing portfolio optimization following the IHS Markit merger, S&P Global completed the sale of its Engineering & Product Design (E&PD) data unit. This divestiture allows the company to sharpen its focus on its core, high-growth financial information, ratings, and analytics businesses while providing capital for reinvestment in strategic areas like private markets and energy transition data.

title: S&P Global Acquires Climate Risk Modeling Firm 'ClimaScore Analytics'
description: S&P Global announced the acquisition of ClimaScore Analytics, a specialized provider of forward-looking physical climate risk data and models for real estate and infrastructure assets. The acquisition deepens the capabilities of S&P Global's Sustainable1 division, allowing it to offer more granular, asset-level climate risk assessments to investors, insurers, and corporations navigating climate transition and regulatory disclosure requirements.

title: S&P Global and Google Cloud Announce Strategic Partnership for AI-Powered Analytics
description: S&P Global entered a strategic partnership with Google Cloud to integrate its proprietary datasets, including Capital IQ and Platts data, directly into the Google Cloud Vertex AI platform. This collaboration enables clients to build, train, and deploy custom AI models for advanced risk management and investment analysis, significantly reducing data onboarding time and accelerating the adoption of AI in financial services.

title: S&P Global Acquires Private Market Data Firm 'Precentis'
description: S&P Global announced the acquisition of Precentis, a specialized data provider focused on private credit and middle-market company financials, for $350 million. This bolt-on acquisition is intended to deepen the data offerings within S&P's Market Intelligence segment, addressing increasing client demand for reliable data and analytics on opaque private capital markets.

title: S&P Global Announces Strategic Partnership with Databricks for AI-Powered Analytics
description: S&P Global has formed a strategic partnership with data and AI company Databricks to enhance its data analytics capabilities and accelerate the deployment of generative AI solutions. The collaboration will leverage the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify S&P's vast datasets, enabling the development of next-generation tools for clients in its Market Intelligence and Commodity Insights divisions.

title: S&P Global Board Authorizes $4 Billion Accelerated Share Repurchase Program
description: Following its strong second-quarter earnings report, the S&P Global Board of Directors has approved a new $4 billion accelerated share repurchase (ASR) program. This action reflects the company's robust cash flow generation and ongoing commitment to returning capital to shareholders, signaling confidence in its long-term growth trajectory and current stock valuation.

title: S&P Global Announces $4 Billion Share Repurchase Program
description: Following its Q2 2025 earnings release, S&P Global's Board of Directors authorized a new $4 billion share repurchase program, reflecting strong cash flow and a commitment to returning capital to shareholders.

title: S&P Global and Google Cloud Expand Partnership for Generative AI
description: S&P Global expanded its partnership with Google Cloud to integrate its proprietary datasets into the Vertex AI platform, enabling clients to build custom generative AI models for financial analysis.

title: S&P Global Acquires ClarityData Solutions for Private Market Intelligence
description: S&P Global acquired ClarityData Solutions, a private credit and venture capital data provider, to deepen the S&P Global Market Intelligence division's capabilities in private markets.

title: S&P Global Acquires Climate Risk Analytics Firm ClimaScore
description: S&P Global acquired ClimaScore, an AI-powered physical climate risk analytics provider, to further enhance the S&P Global Sustainable1 division's asset-level data capabilities.

title: S&P Global Expands Partnership with Palantir
description: S&P Global expanded its partnership with Palantir to integrate its extensive financial, ESG, and industry-specific datasets into the Foundry platform, targeting financial services and energy clients.

title: S&P Global Divests Engineering Solutions Business
description: S&P Global divested its Engineering Solutions division to private equity firm Apex Partners for $975M, allowing the company to focus on core data, analytics, and ESG growth areas.

title: S&P Global Expands Partnership with Snowflake
description: S&P Global expanded its partnership with Snowflake to make more of its datasets, including Market Intelligence and Commodity Insights, directly available on the Snowflake Marketplace for easier client integration.

title: S&P Global Acquires Climate-Risk Data Firm GeoClarity
description: S&P Global acquired GeoClarity, a provider of asset-level climate risk data, to enhance the S&P Global Sustainable1 platform and meet client demand for granular physical climate risk data.

title: S&P Global Commodity Insights Partners with Palantir
description: S&P Global announced a partnership to integrate its benchmark commodity data into Palantir's Foundry platform, providing energy and materials clients with enhanced tools for supply chain modeling and risk management.

title: S&P Global Announces $1.2 Billion Senior Notes Offering
description: S&P Global announced the pricing of a $1.2 billion offering of senior unsecured notes to refinance existing debt and for general corporate purposes. This move optimizes the company's capital structure by locking in current interest rates and ensures financial flexibility for future strategic investments and shareholder returns.

title: S&P Global Announces Strategic Partnership with Databricks
description: S&P Global formed a strategic partnership with data and AI company Databricks to enhance its data delivery and analytics platforms. The collaboration will leverage the Databricks Lakehouse Platform to unify S&P's vast datasets, accelerate the development of AI-powered products, and provide clients with more flexible and efficient access to integrated market intelligence.

title: S&P Global Acquires Climate Risk Analytics Firm 'ClimaScore'
description: S&P Global announced the acquisition of ClimaScore, a specialized provider of physical climate risk analytics and asset-level modeling. The acquisition deepens the capabilities of S&P's Sustainable1 division, integrating ClimaScore's platform to provide more granular climate-related risk data for corporate and financial clients, addressing increasing regulatory and investor demand.

title: S&P Global Divests Engineering Solutions Unit to KKR
description: As part of its ongoing portfolio optimization strategy following the IHS Markit merger, S&P Global announced the divestiture of its Engineering Solutions division to KKR. This unit, which provides access to technical standards and documents, is considered non-core to the company's primary focus on financial data, analytics, and benchmarks. The sale allows for reinvestment into higher-growth areas like ESG and private markets data.

title: S&P Global Partners with Snowflake to Launch Integrated Data Cloud Solution
description: S&P Global entered a strategic partnership with Snowflake to deliver its extensive datasets directly through the Snowflake Marketplace. This collaboration allows clients to seamlessly access and integrate S&P Global's financial, ESG, and industry data within their own cloud environments, reducing data friction and accelerating the development of advanced analytics and AI models.

title: S&P Global Acquires Private Market Data Firm 'Preqin Data Solutions'
description: S&P Global announced the acquisition of Preqin Data Solutions, a leading provider of data and analytics for the private capital markets, to enhance its Market Intelligence division. This strategic move addresses growing client demand for comprehensive data on private equity, venture capital, and private debt, strengthening S&P's competitive position in the alternative investments intelligence space.

title: S&P Global Announces $4 Billion Share Repurchase Program
description: Concurrent with its Q4 2024 earnings release, S&P Global's Board of Directors authorized a new $4 billion share repurchase program. This action reflects the company's strong cash flow generation and commitment to returning capital to shareholders, signaling confidence in its future earnings power and long-term strategic direction.

title: S&P Global Acquires Climate Risk Analytics Firm 'Climatra'
description: S&P Global announced the acquisition of Climatra, a specialized provider of physical climate risk data and modeling for corporate and sovereign entities. The acquisition enhances the S&P Global Sustainable1 division by integrating Climatra's asset-level climate analytics into its existing suite of ESG products. This strategic bolt-on acquisition addresses growing client demand for sophisticated tools to measure and manage the financial impact of climate change.

title: S&P Global and Google Cloud Announce Strategic Partnership to Integrate Generative AI
description: S&P Global announced a multi-year strategic partnership with Google Cloud to co-develop generative AI solutions for its data platforms, including Capital IQ Pro. The collaboration aims to provide clients with advanced natural language search capabilities, automated report generation, and deeper analytical insights, leveraging Google's Vertex AI platform. This move is intended to accelerate product development and solidify S&P Global's position as a leader in AI-driven financial intelligence.

title: Acquisition of Matterhorn
description: S&P Global announced it has signed an agreement to acquire Matterhorn, a provider of private markets data and analytics.

title: Senior Notes Offering
description: S&P Global announced the pricing of a public offering of $750 million of 5.150% Senior Notes due 2029 and $750 million of 5.400% Senior Notes due 2034.

title: Acquisition of TruSight Solutions LLC
description: S&P Global announced it has signed an agreement to acquire TruSight Solutions LLC, a provider of third-party risk management (TPRM) solutions.

title: Q1 2024 Share Repurchase
description: In its Q1 2024 earnings report, S&P Global announced it had repurchased approximately 1.2 million of its common shares for $500 million during the quarter.

title: Acquisition of Visible Alpha
description: S&P Global announced it has signed an agreement to acquire Visible Alpha, a financial technology company providing consensus data and analytics from sell-side analyst models.

title: Divestiture of Engineering Solutions Business
description: S&P Global completed the sale of its Engineering Solutions business to an affiliate of KKR. The transaction was initially announced on November 28, 2023.

title: Divestiture of Engineering Solutions Business
description: S&P Global announced a definitive agreement to sell its Engineering Solutions business to private equity firm KKR for $975 million in cash.

title: Divestiture of Fincentric Business
description: S&P Global announced a definitive agreement to sell its Fincentric business, a provider of data and workflow solutions for the retail banking sector, to an affiliate of ION.

title: Acquisition of TruSight
description: S&P Global announced the acquisition of TruSight, a provider of third-party risk management (TPRM) solutions, from a consortium of leading financial institutions.
counterparty: Consortium including Bank of America, BNY Mellon, JPMorgan Chase, and Wells Fargo

title: Senior Notes Offering
description: S&P Global priced an underwritten public offering of $600 million of 4.750% senior notes due 2026 and $900 million of 5.000% senior notes due 2033. The proceeds were intended for general corporate purposes, including share repurchases.
counterparty: Underwriters including BofA Securities, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, J.P. Morgan, and Morgan Stanley

title: Acquisition of Visible Alpha
description: S&P Global announced a definitive agreement to acquire Visible Alpha, a financial technology provider of deep consensus data and analytics from a consortium of investment banks. The acquisition includes ChartIQ, a provider of data visualization tools.
counterparty: Consortium including Bank of America, Citi, Jefferies, Morgan Stanley, and Goldman Sachs

title: Accelerated Share Repurchase Agreement
description: S&P Global entered into an accelerated share repurchase (ASR) agreement with Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC to repurchase $2.0 billion of its common stock.

title: Senior Notes Offering
description: Announced the pricing of a public offering of $3.0 billion aggregate principal amount of senior notes in four tranches to be used for general corporate purposes, including share repurchases.

title: Divestiture of Leveraged Commentary & Data (LCD)
description: Completed the sale of its Leveraged Commentary and Data (LCD) business and a related family of leveraged loan indices to Morningstar, Inc. This was the final required divestiture for the IHS Markit merger.

title: Divestiture of OPIS and other IHS Markit businesses
description: Completed the sale of IHS Markit's Oil Price Information Service (OPIS); Coal, Metals and Mining; and PetroChem Wire businesses to News Corp as part of the regulatory approval process for the merger.

title: Acquisition of Shades of Green
description: Acquired the Shades of Green business from the Center for International Climate Research (CICERO), a leading global provider of second-party opinions on green and sustainable financing frameworks.

title: Acquisition of Minery
description: S&P Global Commodity Insights acquired Minery, a specialist in providing raw material costs and market prices for the automotive sector, to expand its supply chain and procurement offerings.

title: Accelerated Share Repurchase Program
description: Entered into accelerated share repurchase (ASR) agreements with financial institutions to repurchase $6.5 billion of its common stock, utilizing proceeds from merger-related divestitures.

title: Divestiture of CUSIP Global Services
description: Completed the sale of CUSIP Global Services (CGS) to FactSet Research Systems Inc. This divestiture was a condition for regulatory approval of the IHS Markit merger.

title: Completion of Merger with IHS Markit
description: S&P Global completed its all-stock merger with IHS Markit, creating a leading global provider of information, data, and analytics.

title: Acquisition of ChartIQ
description: S&P Global Market Intelligence acquired ChartIQ, a provider of data visualization and charting solutions for the financial services industry, to integrate advanced charting capabilities into its platforms.

title: Acquisition of The Climate Service, Inc.
description: S&P Global acquired The Climate Service, Inc., a leader in climate risk analytics for corporations, financial institutions, and governments, to enhance its ESG and climate-related data offerings.

title: Divestiture of CUSIP Global Services
description: S&P Global announced a definitive agreement to sell its CUSIP Global Services (CGS) business to FactSet for approximately $1.925 billion in cash. This divestiture was undertaken to address regulatory requirements for the IHS Markit merger.

title: Divestiture of OPIS and related assets
description: As part of the regulatory approval process for the S&P Global and IHS Markit merger, IHS Markit agreed to sell its Oil Price Information Service (OPIS) business and related assets (including Coal, Metals and Mining and PetroChem Wire) to News Corp.

title: Senior Notes Offering
description: S&P Global issued $1.0 billion of 1.250% senior notes due 2026 and $1.0 billion of 2.300% senior notes due 2031. Net proceeds were intended for general corporate purposes, including financing a portion of the IHS Markit merger.

title: Acquisition of Green-e tracking business
description: S&P Global Platts acquired the renewable energy certificate (REC) and carbon offset tracking business from the non-profit Center for Resource Solutions (CRS).

title: Shareholder Approval of IHS Markit Merger
description: Shareholders of both S&P Global and IHS Markit voted to approve the all-stock merger transaction, a key milestone towards the deal's completion.

title: Acquisition of The Climate Service, Inc.
description: S&P Global acquired The Climate Service, Inc., a provider of climate risk analytics, to enhance its ESG and climate-related data and analytics offerings.
